- `./sophia` now loads only `.env.master`. No `~/.config`, no ESC fallback.
- `unified-system-manager.sh` sources only `.env.master` and exits with one clear line if missing.
- No scripts will ask for keys. If missing, you see one line: “.env.master not found at …; cp .env.template .env.master && chmod 600 .env.master”.

This repository uses a single canonical `.env.master` for local development, validated against `config/env.schema.json`. Real secrets and environment-specific values are sourced from Pulumi ESC (dev/staging/prod) in CI/CD.
- No real secrets in Git; `.env.master` contains safe placeholders.
- Python: `config/python_settings.py` (`settings_from_env()`) reads `.env.master` in `APP_ENV=dev`, overlays with process env.

> Environment Policy (2025-09-13): The only supported local environment file is `<repo>/.env.master`. Any references to `.env.local` or `~/.config/sophia/env` in older sections are deprecated. See `docs/CENTRAL_ENV_AND_GITHUB.md` and use `scripts/start_all_and_validate.sh` to bring up and validate services.
- No secrets in repo. Use `<repo>/.env.master` (single source) or platform secret store.
- The only checked-in template is `.env.master`. Use `./bin/keys edit` to create or update it (600 permissions).
- Avoid recreating `.env.local`; rely on `.env.master` + runtime overrides to keep secrets centralized.

- Remove `.env.master`/`.env.template` from repo, leaving archival copies under `backups/` if needed.
- Restore `.env.master` and `.env.template` from git history if issues arise.

Recent duplication analysis highlighted three competing environment configuration patterns in the repository (`.env.template`, `.env.template`, `.env.master`). Tooling and documentation disagree on which file is canonical, and several loader scripts apply conflicting assumptions about encryption and source of truth. This misalignment has created deployment instability and onboarding friction.
3. Deprecate `.env.template`, `.env.master`, and ad-hoc environment bootstrap logic once migration tooling is ready.

If blockers surface during implementation, revert references to `.env.master` by restoring the previous onboarding docs and reinstituting legacy loader scripts from git history (commit prior to standardization). Document the issue in `/notify` and reschedule the migration after gaps are closed.
- Ensure secrets are not in the repo. Place local values in `<repo>/.env.master` and pass to Fly using `fly secrets set`.
- Environment copies consolidated: `.env`, `.env.local`, `.env.local.example` removed from root; `.env.master` remains source of truth
